Override Costs: Once an ignition interlock device has been installed in your vehicle, you will be required to pass a breathalyzer test in order to start your vehicle and keep it running. In the event that you fail a breath test, your vehicle will go into a lockdown mode, and you will be unable to start it.

Ignition interlocks are sold or rented by private companies authorized or licensed by the state. Renting an ignition interlock device generally costs between $70 and $100 per month, plus tax, and installing one can cost as much as $100 to $200. You are expected to pay these costs, along with any maintenance expenses, and fees for downloading the records the device stores.

Ignition Interlock Device Prices. The overall cost of installation, calibration and scheduled maintenance is the responsibility of the offender. An ignition interlock device will cost around $75 per month and a couple hundred dollars to be installed. Prices vary across the United States for the installation and lease of an ignition interlock system. You can expect to pay up to $100 for installation and between $50-$100 per month for the lease. This is a rough estimate and your price may be higher or lower depending on your geographic location. An ignition interlock device (IID) is similar to a breathalyzer, however an IID is connected to the vehicle dashboard or other location inside the vehicle and requires that a driver breath into the device prior to starting the vehicle.
